parameters.name: _return_fields+

parameters.description: Enter the number of results to be fetched
parameters.name: _max_results

parameters.description: Select 1 if result is required as a object
parameters.name: _return_as_object

parameters.description: Select 1 if paging is required. If SET, _max_results and _return_as_object must be entered.
parameters.name: _paging

parameters.description: Enter the page ID for fetching next page
parameters.name: _page_id

parameters.description: Enter the value of the field
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Enter the value of the field
parameters.name: rpz_rule

parameters.description: Enter the value of the field
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Enter the value of the field
parameters.name: view

parameters.description: Enter the value of the field
parameters.name: zone

ipv6addr.description: The IPv6 Address of the Grid member.

ipv4addr.description: The IPv4 Address of the Grid member.

name.description: The name of the Taxii Member.

enable_service.description: Indicates whether the Taxii service is running on the given member or not.

comment.description: The comment for the record; maximum 256 characters.

name.description: The name for a record in FQDN format. This value cannot be in unicode format.

zone.description: The name of the zone in which the record resides. Example: zone.com. If a view is not specified when searching by zone, the default view is used.

ttl.description: The Time To Live (TTL) value for record. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the record is valid (cached). Zero indicates that the record should not be cached.

rp_zone.description: The name of a response policy zone in which the record resides.

disable.description: Determines if the record is disabled or not. False means that the record is enabled.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

ipv6addr.description: The IPv6 Address of the substitute rule.

view.description: The name of the DNS View in which the record resides. Example: external.

comment.description: The comment for the record; maximum 256 characters.

rp_zone.description: The name of a response policy zone in which the record resides.

name.description: The name for a record in FQDN format. This value cannot be in unicode format.

weight.description: The weight of the Substitute (SRV Record) Rule. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

ttl.description: The Time To Live (TTL) value for record. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the record is valid (cached). Zero indicates that the record should not be cached.

priority.description: The priority of the Substitute (SRV Record) Rule. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

zone.description: The name of the zone in which the record resides. Example: zone.com. If a view is not specified when searching by zone, the default view is used.

disable.description: Determines if the record is disabled or not. False means that the record is enabled.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

view.description: The name of the DNS View in which the record resides. Example: external.

port.description: The port of the Substitute (SRV Record) Rule. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

target.description: The target of the Substitute (SRV Record) Rule in FQDN format. This value can be in unicode format.

rp_zones.description: An ordered list of Response Policy Zone names.

is_ipv4.description: Indicates whether the record is an IPv4 record. If the return value is true, it is an IPv4 record. Ohterwise, it is an IPv6 record.

text.description: Text associated with the record. It can contain up to 255 bytes per substring, up to a total of 512 bytes. To enter leading, trailing, or embedded spaces in the text, add quotes around the text to preserve the spaces.

comment.description: The descriptive comment of the record associated with the allrpzrecords object.

alert_type.description: The alert type of the record associated with the allrpzrecords object.

last_updated.description: The time when the record associated with the allrpzrecords object was last updated.

name.description: The name of the record associated with the allrpzrecords object. Note that this value might be different than the value of the name field for the associated record.

zone.description: The Response Policy Zone name of the record associated with the allrpzrecords object.

rpz_rule.description: The RPZ rule type of the record associated with the allrpzrecrods object.

record.description: The record object associated with the allrpzrecords object.

disable.description: The disable flag of the record associated with the allrpzrecords object (if present).

ttl.description: The TTL value of the record associated with the allrpzrecords object (if present).

expiration_time.description: The expiration time of the record associated with the allrpzrecords object.

type.description: The type of record associated with the allrpzrecords object. This is a descriptive string that identifies the record to which this allrpzrecords object refers. (Examples: 'record:rpz:a', 'record:rpz:mx', etc.)

view.description: The DNS view name of the record associated with the allrpzrecords object.

comment.description: The comment for the record; maximum 256 characters.

last_queried.description: The time of the last DNS query in Epoch seconds format.

name.description: The name for a record in FQDN format. This value cannot be in unicode format.

zone.description: The name of the zone in which the record resides. Example: zone.com. If a view is not specified when searching by zone, the default view is used.

ttl.description: The Time To Live (TTL) value for record. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the record is valid (cached). Zero indicates that the record should not be cached.

rp_zone.description: The name of a response policy zone in which the record resides.

disable.description: Determines if the record is disabled or not. False means that the record is enabled.

flags.description: The flags used to control the interpretation of the fields for a Substitute (NAPTR Record) Rule object. Supported values for the flags field are U, S, P and A.

preference.description: The preference of the Substitute (NAPTR Record) Rule record. The preference field determines the order NAPTR records are processed when multiple records with the same order parameter are present. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

services.description: The services field of the Substitute (NAPTR Record) Rule object; maximum 128 characters. The services field contains protocol and service identifiers, such as http+E2U or SIPS+D2T.

regexp.description: The regular expression-based rewriting rule of the Substitute (NAPTR Record) Rule record. This should be a POSIX compliant regular expression, including the substitution rule and flags. Refer to RFC 2915 for the field syntax details.

view.description: The name of the DNS View in which the record resides. Example: external.

order.description: The order parameter of the Substitute (NAPTR Record) Rule records. This parameter specifies the order in which the NAPTR rules are applied when multiple rules are present. Valid values are from 0 to 65535 (inclusive), in 32-bit unsigned integer format.

replacement.description: The replacement field of the Substitute (NAPTR Record) Rule object. For nonterminal NAPTR records, this field specifies the next domain name to look up. This value can be in unicode format.

rp_zone.description: The name of a response policy zone in which the record resides.

disable.description: Determines if the record is disabled or not. False means that the record is enabled.
